text: long time subscriber and love the application selection is huge thing just work minor criticism include the inability to use mobile a a remote control a specify allows the lower subscription value from couture red not working in many country and the fact that once i start playing a playlist i can not shuffle can only do that before you start playing it also super easy to accidentally remove item from playlist there is undo but easy to miss it or remove multiple thing by accident
original_text: Long time subscriber and love the app. Selection is huge. Things just work. Minor criticisms include the inability to use mobile as a remote control (as Spotify allows), the lower subscription value from YouTube Red not working in many countries, and the fact that once I start playing a Playlist, I cannot shuffle (can only do that before you start playing it!). Also super easy to accidentally remove items from Playlists (there's undo, but easy to miss it or remove multiple things by accident).

text: not compatible with sd storage on marshmallow do not switch to internal sd on marshmallow or goole play will not recognize sd storage on marshmallow my phone has gb of storage but a gb sd card i got the sd card specifically to work with goole play music the sd card specifically to work with goole play music worked fine in lollipop i updated to marshmallow and formatted the sd card specifically to work with goole play music a internal storage now the application doe not see the storage space so i have gb sitting unused other aps do not work with portable storage this is ridiculous also the most recent update took out the ability to skip to the next song from moto display i do not know what idiot made the decision that user would rather be able to thumb up than skip forward but user were wrong now the application take way more click to skip forward
original_text: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH SD STORAGE ON MARSHMALLOW. DO NOT SWITCH TO INTERNAL SD ON MARSHMALLOW OR GOOGLE PLAY WILL NOT RECOGNIZE THAT STORAGE. My phone has 8GB of storage but a 32 GB SD card. I got the SD card specifically to work with Google Play Music. It worked fine in Lollipop. I updated to Marshmallow and formatted the card as Internal storage. Now the app doesn't see the storage space so I have 28 GB sitting unused. Other apps don't work with portable storage. This is ridiculous.  Also, the most recent update took out the ability to skip to the next song from Moto Display. I don't know what idiot made the decision that users would rather be able to thumbs up than skip forward, but they were wrong. Now the app takes way more clicks to skip forward.

text: version samsung galaxy s lack shuffle play for album which is inconvenient shuffle song only more importantly the application lack any option for volume normalization i have approximately k song in my personal library and the volume fluctuates markedly from track to track on the same album i have tried a number of third party aps purporting to overcome the lack of inbuilt volume normalization but they do not appear to have any effect whatsoever i have returned to my ancient apple pod classic gb to enjoy my music with volume normalization disappointing for me who avoids apple product a far a possible
original_text: Version 8.5.6542 Samsung Galaxy S4  Lacks shuffle play for albums which is inconvenient. Shuffles songs only  More importantly the app lacks any option for volume normalization. I have approximately 19K songs in my personal library and the volume fluctuates markedly from track to track on the same album  I've tried a number of third party apps purporting to overcome the lack of inbuilt volume normalization but they don't appear to have any effect whatsoever  I've returned to my ancient Apple iPod Classic (120GB) to enjoy my music with volume normalization. Disappointing for me who avoids Apple products as far as possible

text: to anyone having an issue with it force closing after updating to remove the downloaded album by going to setting and then manage download every single album remove from there then open the application info for play music and force close it and click on storage and delete all data then instal and deinstall after it installed set it up again and download the downloaded album again and it will work fine knock on wood laugh out loud
original_text: to anyone having an issue with it force closing after updating to 9.0; remove the downloaded albums by going to "settings" and then "manage downloads". EVERY SINGLE ALBUM, remove from there. then open the app info for Play Music and force close it, and click on Storage and Delete All Data then uninstall and reinstall. after its reinstalled, set it up again, and redownload all albums again, and it'll work fine. knock on wood lol.

original_text: This is an amazing app for finding and listening to music. I use it primarily via bluetooth in my car. I have two gripes though so it only gets 4 stars. 1. Often I will want to listen to one of my playlists in order. text: wondered if i should stick to deer or keep bobbing back and forth between apple music and specify and then i found goole play music to be just right and without having to downloadinstal another extra application to my already storageconstrained mobile phone so is it good well yeah hence the five-star rating ye big dummy laugh out loud okay maybe you like specify more or deer or tidal or even apple music on android even they are all excellent choice for you it is just a choice

So, is it good? Well, yeah... Hence the five-star rating ye big dummy. LOL. Okay, maybe you like Spotify more, or Deezer, or Tidal, or even Apple Music (on Android even) they are all excellent choices for you. It's just a choice.

original_text: Thank you. I asked for offline and wifi controls for bandwidth and read the news. I can now give 4 stars. Why not 5? I remembered Spotify which displays unplayable tracks. When content is removed from a music service, this would be the only way to know it, as well as where those tracks used to exist in playlists and what disappeared from our library. Here we are 2 years later and have yet to see this feature. Which is why I've gone back to Spotify.

text: after using it for a while i feel there is room for improvement i experienced a few minor glitch sometimes when browsing while playing a song the song name would change to that of another is also sometimes the music would suddenly stop playing for no apparent reason but that only happened twice with me there should also be a few more feature like the ability to change song info on mobile or the ability to cast your music to another device overall very good application
original_text: After using it for a while, I feel there is room for improvement. I experienced a few minor glitches. Sometimes, when browsing while playing a song, the song name would change to that of another's. Also sometimes, the music would suddenly stop playing for no apparent reason, but that only happened twice with me. There should also be a few more features, like the ability to change song info on mobile or the ability to cast your music to another device. Overall, very good app.

text: this is an amazing application for finding and listening to music i use this primarily via bluetooth in my car i have two gripe though so this only get star often i will want to listen to one of my playlist in order i can start listening with shuffle off without issue but if i leave my car and resume listening later shuffle mode will have turned my car on when listening on shuffle sometimes the track info reported to my car via bluetooth will be for a totally different song
original_text: This is an amazing app for finding and listening to music. I use it primarily via bluetooth in my car. I have two gripes though so it only gets 4 stars. 1. Often I will want to listen to one of my playlists in order. I can start listening with shuffle off without issue, but if I leave the car and resume listening later, shuffle mode will have turned itself on. 2. when listening on shuffle, sometimes the track info reported to my car via bluetooth will be for a totally different song.

The final nail in the coffin for me is that a lot of my uploaded music is not visible, only on the web. There's been no evident UX updates, it's material design 1.0, so looks quite lame when compared to some other Google apps.

text: been using this application for year still no big update or visual refresh to the ui waiting to see what happens with the merger with couture music signed up for the free trial during the holiday started paying for the family plan shortly after application update have continued to improve the application podcasts radio etc family plan is the best value hand down some people do not like the ui but family plan work great for me family plan can run slow hang up sometimes but other than that i have no issue
original_text: Been using this app for years, still no big update or visual refresh to the UI. Waiting to see what happens with the merger with YouTube music. Signed up for the free trial during the holidays started paying for the $14.99 family plan shortly after. App updates have continued to improve the app, podcasts, radio, etc. Family plan is the best value hands down. Some people don't like the UI but it works great for me. It can run slow, hang up sometimes but other than that I have no issues.

text: version samsung galaxy s lack shuffle play for album which is inconvenient shuffle song only more importantly the application lack any option for volume normalization i have approximately k song in my personal library and the volume fluctuates markedly from track to track on the same album i have tried a number of third party aps purporting to overcome the lack of inbuilt volume normalization but they do not appear to have any effect whatsoever i have returned to my ancient apple pod classic gb to enjoy my music with volume normalization disappointing for me who avoids apple product a far a possible
original_text: Version 8.5.6542 Samsung Galaxy S4  Lacks shuffle play for albums which is inconvenient. Shuffles songs only  More importantly the app lacks any option for volume normalization. I have approximately 19K songs in my personal library and the volume fluctuates markedly from track to track on the same album  I've tried a number of third party apps purporting to overcome the lack of inbuilt volume normalization but they don't appear to have any effect whatsoever  I've returned to my ancient Apple iPod Classic (120GB) to enjoy my music with volume normalization. Disappointing for me who avoids Apple products as far as possible

text: i actually really like play music i think it is a really underrated service but i am discontinuing my subscription there are a few thing the major one being the inability to download music on pc unlike it is competitor specify it is a simple a creating a desktop application for play music and once that happens i can almost guarantee i will be back to a really underrated service the other minor thing is the singing between phone and web application adding on one will add to the other no problem but on the phone application adding an album will add an album unordered but the phone application adding an album will have the phone application adding an album ordered a well a when you add a song from an album you already have on the phone application adding an album the rest of an album will come to the top of the recently added but on mobile the phone application adding an album will not for someone who like their thing in sync it is slightly annoying again i think it is a good service for a good price but it has to tighten up few thing before it can really overtake it is competitor
original_text: I actually really like Play Music. I think it's a really underrated service. But I'm discontinuing my subscription. There are a few things, the major one being the inability to download music on PC, unlike it's competitor Spotify. It's as simple as creating a desktop app for Play Music, and once that happens, I can almost guarantee I'll be back to this service. The other minor thing is the syncing between phone and web app. Adding on one will add to the other no problem, but on the phone app adding an album will add the album un-ordered, but the web app will have it ordered. As well as when you add a song from an album you already have, on the web app the rest of the album will come to the top of the 'recently added' but on mobile it won't. For someone who likes their things in sync, it's slightly annoying.  Again, I think it is a good service for a good price. But it has to tighten up few things before it can really overtake it's competitors.

text: the recent update made this much le functional in android auto in android auto the recent update open to a music for driving screen i literally have never listened to any of the three suggestion i normally listen to the same playlist while driving and that playlist is never one of the option so i have to go into an additional menu to get to my playlist the music for driving basically add one additional button press to get to what i want also if you are quickly trying to get to a song in a playlist and get to the queue screen it list the song in your playlist but to quickly get to the a search you have to scroll all the way up if you are driving not only is that dangerous the application then block you from searching for a few second just make the a search easier to get to those designing the ui just think if you are adding additional press to get to same functionality you are doing something wrong
original_text: The recent update made this much less functional in Android Auto. In Android Auto, it opens to a "Music for Driving" screen. I literally have never listened to any of the three suggestions. I normally listen to the same playlist while driving and that playlist is never one of the options. So I have to go into an additional menu to get to my playlists. The "Music for Driving" basically adds one additional button press to get to what I want.   Also, if you're quickly trying to get to a song in a playlist and get to the queue screen, it lists the songs in your playlist, but to quickly get to the A-Z search you have to scroll all the way up. If you're driving, not only is that dangerous, the app then blocks you from searching for a few seconds. Just make the A-Z search easier to get to!   Those designing the UI, just think, if you're adding additional presses to get to same functionality, you're doing something wrong.

text: to anyone having an issue with it force closing after updating to remove the downloaded album by going to setting and then manage download every single album remove from there then open the application info for play music and force close it and click on storage and delete all data then instal and deinstall after it installed set it up again and download the downloaded album again and it will work fine knock on wood laugh out loud
original_text: to anyone having an issue with it force closing after updating to 9.0; remove the downloaded albums by going to "settings" and then "manage downloads". EVERY SINGLE ALBUM, remove from there. then open the app info for Play Music and force close it, and click on Storage and Delete All Data then uninstall and reinstall. after its reinstalled, set it up again, and redownload all albums again, and it'll work fine. knock on wood lol.

text: not good stay away if you plan to use on the long run problem are but not limited to music disappearing from song and playlist and there is no possible way to perform a back up and restore for case like these the scroll bar get in the way when you want to view additional menu for a particular song eg adding a song to a playlist sync issue especially after extended usage
original_text: Not good. Stay away if you plan to use on the long run. Problems are but not limited to - Music disappearing from Songs and Playlists, and there is no possible way to perform a back up and restore for cases like these. - The scroll bar gets in the way when you want to view additional menus for a particular song, eg adding a song to a playlist. - Sync issues especially after extended usage.

text: my only gripe is that i have little control over my library i do not want all the song on my device to be part of my library but this application give me no option to exclude anything i also can not delete anything on my device from my library more control over what is or is not in my music database should be viable tune is more useful in that regard if goole play made these thing available goole play would be my music resource for these reason star

If Google Play made these things available it would be my #1 music resource. For these reasons..., 3 stars.
